tv.freewheel.renderers.interfaces

Interface IRendererContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IParameterHolder

    public interface IRendererContext
extends IParameterHolder
    Interface for a renderer to obtain information from AdManager.

    • Method Summary

      • getInitialAdVolume

        float getInitialAdVolume()
        Get the volume for ad playback Renderer, while starting an ad playback, should use this API to set the initial volume of the ad
        Returns:
        A float in the range [0,1]

      • getActivity

        android.app.Activity getActivity()
        Return application's current Activity which create and hold the reference of this AdContext.
        Returns:
        the Activity object

      • setSupportedAdEvent

        void setSupportedAdEvent(java.lang.String adEventName,
                         boolean supported)
        Declare capability of the renderer.
        Parameters:
        adEventName - one of EVENT_AD_* (NOT including EVENT_AD_FIRST_QUARTILE, EVENT_AD_THIRD_QUARTILE, EVENT_AD_IMPRESSION) in IConstants
        supported - true, if the renderer is able to process the specified ad event

      • dispatchEvent

        void dispatchEvent(java.lang.String eventName)
        Dispatch renderer event.
        Parameters:
        eventName - event to be processed, one of EVENT_AD_* and EVENT_REQUEST_CONTENT_VIDEO_* in IConstants

      • dispatchEvent

        void dispatchEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> extraInfo)
        Dispatch renderer event.
        Parameters:
        eventName - event to be processed, one of EVENT_AD_* and EVENT_REQUEST_CONTENT_VIDEO_* in IConstants
        extraInfo - additional information need to be processed by AdManager. Available keys:
        - INFO_KEY_ERROR_CODE Optional.
        When eventName is EVENT_ERROR, use this key to specify the error code.
        - INFO_KEY_ERROR_INFO Optional.
        When eventName is EVENT_ERROR, use this key to specify the description of the error.
        - INFO_KEY_SHOW_BROWSER Optional.
        Only valid when the eventName is EVENT_AD_CLICK, the value should be boolean
        use this key to specify whether the click event should open a browser if possible
        the default value is true
        - INFO_KEY_URL Optional.
        Only valid when the eventName is EVENT_AD_CLICK, the value should be String.
        use this key to specify redirect URL.
        the default value is the one specified on MRM UI.
        - INFO_KEY_MESSAGE Optional.
        When eventName is EVENT_CLICK, use this key to specify the name of custom click

      • getLocation

        android.location.Location getLocation()
        Get the location of device. This value was set by IAdManager.setLocation and will not be change in the AdContext's lifetime.
        Returns:
        the location value which App set through IAdManager.setLocation. will be null if not set

      • addOnActivityStateChangedListener

        void addOnActivityStateChangedListener(IActivityStateChangeCallbackListener activityStateChangeCallbackListener)
        Register event callback listener for Activity's state changes
        Parameters:
        activityStateChangeCallbackListener - the callback listener responding to activity's state changes. activityStateChangeCallbackListener will be called with activity state's IConstants.ActivityState.PAUSED, IConstants.ActivityState.RESUMED

      • scheduleAdInstances

        java.util.List<IAdInstance> scheduleAdInstances(java.util.List<ISlot> slots)
        Schedule ad instances for slots passed in as parameter. Usually slots consists of current slot and its companion slots.
        Parameters:
        slots - slots to be scheduled for ads
        Returns:
        List of scheduled IAdInstance

      • getCompanionSlots

        java.util.List<ISlot> getCompanionSlots()
        Return the companion slots which are able to schedule companion.
        Returns:
        List of companion ISlot

      • getVersion

        int getVersion()
        Get SDK version.
        Returns:
        Current version as int, e.g., 0x02060000 for v2.6

      • requestTimelinePause

        void requestTimelinePause()
        Request timeline to pause. The timeline consists of the content video and all linear slots. When the renderer or extension requires the timeline to be temporarily paused, e.g. when expanding to a fullscreen view that covers the whole player and other ads, calling this method will result in the event EVENT_REQUEST_CONTENT_VIDEO_PAUSE() being dispatched from the current FWContext instance if content video is currently playing, and pause requests sent to all active temporal slots.

      • requestTimelineResume

        void requestTimelineResume()
        Request timeline to resume. The timeline consists of the content video and all linear slots. When the renderer or extension requires the timeline to be resumed, e.g. when dismissing a fullscreen view that covers the whole player and other ads, calling this method will result in the event EVENT_REQUEST_CONTENT_VIDEO_RESUME() being dispatched from the current FWContext instance if content video is currently paused, and send resume requests to all active temporal slots.
